objects.string:
You can smash through doors
by throwing your hand at it really fast!

objects.name: worldend_tip

The world is being consumed
by the red square behind you!
Run!!!

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TextToSpeech
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An extension to enable the use of Text-to-Speech features.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Text to Speech extension allows you to use the system's Text-to-Speech features to read any text aloud.

eventsFunctions.description: Speaks a text message aloud through the system text-to-speech.

Here is a list of windows voice names: https://bit.ly/windows-voices 
And here is a list of voice names for MacOS: https://bit.ly/mac-voices

This extension can be useful for:
* Stick an accessory to a moving object,
* Animate a skeleton.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.

Firing bullets:
- Cooldown: Time between shots (seconds)
- Bullet Quantity: Number of bullets created each time Fire Bullet action is used. 
- Angle Variance: Each bullet trajectory will be adjusted by a random value within this range (degrees)
- Firing Arc: Range of angles (in degrees) that bullets will shoot. Bullets are evenly spread within this range.
- Rotate bullet: Change the angle of each bullet to match the direction it is travelling (enabled by default)

 Ammo:
- Starting ammo
- Max ammo
- Shots per reload. Use 0 to disable reloading
- Reload duration
- Automatic reloading is enabled by default, but it can also be done manually.

Overheat:
- Heat increase per shot. Object is Overheated when Heat reaches  1.
- Cooling rate per second
- When overheated, the object cannot fire any bullets

Statistics:
- Total bullets created
- Total shots taken
- Total reloads completed

Bullets:
- Each bullet is assigned several variables that can be used for advanced object picking
- __FireBullet.BulletID = Unique number for every bullet created
- __FireBullet.BatchID = Unique number for all bullets created in the same frame
- __FireBullet.BatchOrderID = Unique number for each bullet in the same batch. Can be used to identify the position in the firing arc.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".

Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.

Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ is on screen (padded by _PARAM2_ pixels)

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value goes inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Jeroen Erkens, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This action is meant to be run on every frame (i.e: usually you would use it without conditions, or just conditions picking the appropriate objects to track).

- Use an object group to track multiple objects.
- Only run on one layer at a time.  If multiple layers need to move the same way, create events that copy CameraX, CameraY, and CameraZoom values.
- This can also be used on a single object instance to move the camera smoothly.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.
eventsFunctions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move camera on layer _PARAM6_ to keep instances of _PARAM1_ on the screen. Use a margin of _PARAM2_px horizontally and _PARAM3_px vertically. Use a zoom between _PARAM4_ and _PARAM5_.  Move the camera at a speed of _PARAM8_

events.comment: Set default values if nothing is entered
Set initial values based on an object instance.  This is used as a valid starting point for comparisons, so it doesn't matter which instance is used.

Loop through every instance of object (or object group) and determine the max position values used for left, right, top and bottom.
Record the height and width of the objects that are on the edges.  These values will be used to increase the camera viewport to include the entire object.
Move camera to the center location
Zoom in or out to keep all object instances on screen
Adjust zoom to stay within min/max values
Change camera zoom

parameters.description: Extra space on sides of screen
parameters.longDescription: Each side will include this buffer
parameters.name: HorizontalBuffer

parameters.description: Extra space on top and bottom of screen
parameters.longDescription: Each side will include this buffer
parameters.name: VerticalBuffer

parameters.longDescription: Limit how far the camera will zoom OUT
parameters.name: MinZoom

parameters.longDescription: Limit how far the camera will zoom IN
parameters.name: MaxZoom

parameters.longDescription: Percent of distance to destination that will be travelled each frame (used by lerp function)
parameters.name: LerpSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.

Damage calculations are performed in this order:

Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health

How to use:

- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use Apply damage to an object
- To heal health, use Heal object action
- To activate the shield, use Activate shield action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
 
Tips:

- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the Blink extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the Is just damaged or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects

Health properties:

- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)

Shield properties:

- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

Shield

Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
propertyDescriptors.name: AllowOverHealing

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum shield (points) Use "0" for no maximum
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxShieldPoints

propertyDescriptors.label: Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Block excess damage when shield is broken
propertyDescriptors.name: BlockExcessDamage

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Chance to dodge incoming damage (Range: 0 to 1) If damage is dodged, no damage is applied
propertyDescriptors.name: ChanceToDodge

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to health from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageToBeApplied

propertyDescriptors.label: Flat damage reduction from armor (incoming damage is reduced by this value)
propertyDescriptors.name: FlatDamageReduction

propertyDescriptors.label: Percentage damage reduction from armor (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: PercentDamageReduction

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to shield from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDamageTaken

propertyDescriptors.label: Health points gained from the previous heal
propertyDescriptors.name: HealToBeApplied
